availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Bramblett (Bourbon Co, Ky, farmer, prov govt, and captain (C.S.A.))

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer, provisional government convention member, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Ann Payne Bramblett in Marion County, Missouri, on February 1, 1854. Farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a captain from September 14, 1861, to January 1, 1863. Died from wounds received at Murfreesboro on January 1, 1863, in Nashville, Tennessee.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 296A.
Missouri Marriage Records, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, Missouri, Marion County Marriages, p. 138.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Find A Grave, "Capt. William Bramblett (Oct 21, 1823-Jan 25, 1863)," Memorial #10162382 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10162382 (accessed October 15, 2019).
